qas.question: What discussion should great powers be included on?

answers.text: political and diplomatic questions of the day

qas.question: Historically, when would great powers meet?

answers.text: when major political questions were addressed

qas.question: What types of decisions would great powers reach?

answers.text: political resolution of various geographical and nationalist claims following a major conflict, or other contexts

plausible_answers.text: enough influence to be included in discussions of political and diplomatic questions of the day, and have influence on the final outcome and resolution

qas.question: What criteria should groups like the UN have?

plausible_answers.text: when major political questions were addressed

qas.question: In the past when would officially named participants meet?

plausible_answers.text: deciding the political resolution of various geographical and nationalist claims following a major conflict

qas.question: What is an example of something United Nations did to settle an issue?
What should geographical and nationalist claims have influence on?

plausible_answers.text: important questions based on major historical events

qas.question: What did criteria throughout history settle?

context: Other important criteria throughout history are that great powers should have <b3_0>enough influence to be included in discussions of <a0_0>political and diplomatic questions of the day<a0_0/>, and have influence on <b6_0>the final outcome and resolution<b6_0/><b3_0/>. Historically, <a1_0><b4_0>when major political questions were addressed<b4_0/><a1_0/>, several great powers met to discuss them. Before the era of groups like the United Nations, participants of such meetings were not officially named, but were decided based on their great power status. These were conferences which settled <b7_0>important questions based on major historical events<b7_0/>. This might mean <b5_0>deciding the <a2_0>political resolution of various geographical and nationalist claims following a major conflict<b5_0/>, or other contexts<a2_0/>.
